intro: Corynanthe johimbe, commonly known as Johimbe, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its roots and stems contain alkaloids, including ajmaline and johimbine, which have been used in traditional medicine. These compounds have also been studied for their potential pharmacological applications.
